017
018package org.tquadrat.foundation.util;
019
020import static org.apiguardian.api.API.Status.STABLE;
021import static org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.Objects.requireNonNullArgument;
022
023import java.util.Comparator;
024import java.util.List;
025import java.util.function.Consumer;
026import java.util.function.Supplier;
027
028import org.apiguardian.api.API;
029import org.tquadrat.foundation.annotation.ClassVersion;
030import org.tquadrat.foundation.util.internal.LazyListImpl;
031
032/**
033 *  The interface for a
034 *  {@link List}
035 *  that will be initialised only when required.
036 *
037 *  @extauthor Thomas Thrien - thomas.thrien@tquadrat.org
038 *  @version $Id: LazyList.java 820 2020-12-29 20:34:22Z tquadrat $
039 *  @since 0.0.5
040 *
041 *  @param  <E> The type of elements in this list.
042 *
043 *  @see org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.Lazy
044 *
045 *  @note   There is no implementation of a {@code map()} method in this
046 *      interface because it is assumed that this would be confusing: such a
047 *      {@code map()} method would operate on the whole list that is wrapped by
048 *      this value, and not on a entry as one would expect. Refer to
049 *      {@link org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.Lazy#map(java.util.function.Function)}.
050 *
051 *  @UMLGraph.link
052 */
053@SuppressWarnings( "preview" )
054@ClassVersion( sourceVersion = "$Id: LazyList.java 820 2020-12-29 20:34:22Z tquadrat $" )
055@API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
056public sealed interface LazyList<E> extends List<E>
057    permits LazyListImpl
058{
059        /*---------*\
060    ====** Methods **==========================================================
061        \*---------*/
062    /**
063     *  If this {@code LazyList} instance has been initialised already, the
064     *  provided
065     *  {@link Consumer}
066     *  will be executed; otherwise nothing happens.
067     *
068     *  @param  consumer    The consumer.
069     */
070    public void ifPresent( final Consumer<? super List<E>> consumer );
071
072    /**
073     *  Forces the initialisation of this {@code LazyList} instance.
074     */
075    public void init();
076
077    /**
078     *  Checks whether this {@code LazyList} instance has been initialised
079     *  already.
080     *
081     *  @return {@code true} if the instance was initialised, {@code false}
082     *      otherwise.
083     */
084    public boolean isPresent();
085
086    /**
087     *  Creates a new {@code LazyList} instance that is already initialised.
088     *
089     *  @param  <E> The type of elements in this list.
090     *  @param  value   The value.
091     *  @return The new instance.
092     */
093    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
094    public static <E> LazyList<E> of( final List<E> value )
095    {
096        return new LazyListImpl<>( requireNonNullArgument( value, "value" ) );
097    }   //  of()
098
099    /**
100     *  {@inheritDoc}
101     */
102    @Override
103    public void sort( final Comparator<? super E> c );
104
105    /**
106     *  Creates a new {@code LazyList} instance that uses the given supplier to
107     *  create the internal map, but that supplier does not provide values on
108     *  initialisation.
109     *
110     *  @param  <E> The type of elements in this list.
111     *  @param  supplier    The supplier that initialises for the new instance
112     *      of {@code LazyList} when needed.
113     *  @return The new instance.
114     */
115    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
116    public static <E> LazyList<E> use( final Supplier<? extends List<E>> supplier )
117    {
118        return new LazyListImpl<>( false, supplier );
119    }   //  use()
120
121    /**
122     *  Creates a new {@code LazyList} instance that uses the given supplier to
123     *  initialise.
124     *
125     *  @param  <E> The type of elements in this list.
126     *  @param  doPopulate  {@code true} if the provided supplier will put
127     *      entries to the list on initialisation, {@code false} if will create
128     *      an empty list.
129     *  @param  supplier    The supplier that initialises for the new instance
130     *      of {@code LazyList} when needed.
131     *  @return The new instance.
132     */
133    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
134    public static <E> LazyList<E> use( final boolean doPopulate, final Supplier<? extends List<E>> supplier )
135    {
136        return new LazyListImpl<>( doPopulate, supplier );
137    }   //  use()
138}
139//  interface LazyList
140
141/*
142 *  End of File
143 */
